The claim was made by Ultraviolet: a women's rights advocacy group, on Facebook on June 15, 2015.
The claim was based on a 21: year-old quote from Jeb Bush during his failed first run for governor in 1994.
Multiple sources: including the Orlando Sentinel and CNN, reported on Jeb Bush's statement about low-income women needing to "get their life together and find a husband."
Jeb Bush: s opponents, including former Florida Attorney General James Smith, used this quote against him during the campaign, leading to a response from Bush defending himself and stating that his words were taken out of context.
